instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-1949: What is 820-1949? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6903: What is U6903? This chip is responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H in 2016-2018 model Macbook logic boards.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A dead board
threads.message: Board came in dead drawing only 5V, PPBUS is present, but <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> is not present, I checked <CHIP>U6903</CHIP> it has it’s power which is PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3HRTC which is 12.3V and the enable signal CHGR_EN_ <SIGNAL>MVR_R</SIGNAL> is 5V, is it a good enable signal

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A dead board
threads.message:
Any fault history, liquid sign?

"<CHIP>U6903</CHIP> it has it’s power which is PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3HRTC"
Wrong assumption; <CHIP>U6903</CHIP> power is PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3HRTC_R!
Don't you consider to check <RESISTOR>R6900</RESISTOR>???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A dead board
threads.message: No history, board just came in dead, apologies I miss the last R because I took measurements on <CAPACITOR>C6907</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C6906</CAPACITOR> which are connected to pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R6900</RESISTOR> and they were good 12.3V just to double check my readings, what about the Enable signal <SIGNAL>CHGR_EN_MVR_R</SIGNAL>?? Is 5V a good one??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A dead board
threads.message:
5V is good there.

Diode mode to ground at L6900?
If good, check <RESISTOR>R6910</RESISTOR>-13 and <CAPACITOR>C6903</CAPACITOR>/10.
If all good, then change <CHIP>U6903</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A dead board
threads.message:
Recap
Board came in dead drawing 5V, PPBUS is present and 12.3V,
 but <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> is not present,
 I checked <CHIP>U6903</CHIP> it has it’s power which is <SIGNAL>PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H_RTC_R</SIGNAL> which is 12.3V and the enable signal CHGR_EN_ <SIGNAL>MVR_R</SIGNAL> is 5V, Which was also confirmed to be good by you. Changed IC <CHIP>U6903</CHIP> and PP3V3_G3H_ RTC was present and board daws 20V from type c charger.
**Now the system came up but getting very hot and shot down( I guessed a thermal shot down) 
**I had to resit the board in the casing,
Now it’s just showing the apple logo without loading the progress bar
** I restored it with configurator 2, it was restored successfully 
** now  it’s stocked on internet recovery,is not loading any progress bar. Internet recovery is not loading

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A dead board
threads.message:
Can you start Diagnostic mode?
Also try in safe mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A dead board
threads.message:
Recap
Board came in dead drawing 5V, PPBUS is present and 12.3V,
but <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> is not present,
I checked <CHIP>U6903</CHIP> it has it’s power which is <SIGNAL>PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H_RTC_R</SIGNAL> which is 12.3V and the enable signal CHGR_EN_ <SIGNAL>MVR_R</SIGNAL> is 5V, Which was also confirmed to be good by you. Changed IC <CHIP>U6903</CHIP> and PP3V3_G3H_ RTC was present and board daws 20V from type c charger.
**Now the system came up but getting very hot and shot down( I guessed a thermal shot down)
**I had to resit the board in the casing,
Now it’s just showing the apple logo without loading the progress bar
** I restored it with configurator 2, it was restored successfully
** now  it’s stocked on internet recovery,is not loading any progress bar. Internet recovery is not loading

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A dead board
threads.message:
after power button it goes straight in to internet mode and the internet mode is dragging.( very very slow)
I can’t start diagnostic mode and safe mode

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A dead board
threads.message:
Start disconnecting cables from MLB, one by one; trackpad, touchbar, touch ID, etc.
See if at any moment progress bar appears.
You can disconnect even internal LCD, testing with external monitor.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A dead board
threads.message:
I discovered I didn’t fix the battery well. So I have done the needful 
Now I got the internet recovery progress bar, but  The processor gets very hot  and the screen will goes blank with glitches on top of the screen. After like 2minutes 
In short the processor gets hot when the system is working well.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A dead board
threads.message:
Check if heatsink does its job; try known good one.
Both fans go to max then?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A dead board
threads.message:
I have changed heat sink, still doing same thing.
 Fan not going to max, fan runs normal

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A dead board
threads.message:
Try again DFU restore.
Disconnect internal LCD and check if external video is affected too.

Check CPU temps with HWMonitor.
